pullRequest.body:
- rename `Function.support_smul_subset_right` to `Function.support_const_smul_subset`

From sphere-eversion; I'm just upstreaming it.

bors d+
Thanks!
This is strictly weaker than [tsupport_smul_subset_left](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Support.html#tsupport_smul_subset_left) right?
Indeed, dropped.

Could you move this next to [tsupport_smul_subset_left](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Support.html#tsupport_smul_subset_left), use the same naming conventions, and weaken the hypotheses to those required by [Function.support_smul_subset_right](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Module/Basic.html#Function.support_smul_subset_right) (plus topology of course) ?
I tried, but for some reason things don't unify.

Ah yes, because `support_smul_subset_right` is about multiplying by a constant "scalar". Would you mind renaming it to `support_const_smul_subset` (thus adjusting the `#align`), and adding
```lean
lemma support_smul_subset_right [Zero M] [SMulZeroClass R M] (f :   R) (g :   M) :
    support (f  g)  support g := fun x hbf hf  hbf <| by rw [Pi.smul_apply', hf, smul_zero]
```
right after [tsupport_smul_subset_left](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/Support.html#tsupport_smul_subset_left)?
Renamed and added the new lemma. The proof of tsupport_smul_right still fails to unify, though.
No, it seems to work (you probably forgot to recompile the imports). Now there's just something to fix in the archives
Indeed. Just fixed the archive.
Does `support_smul_subset_right (fun _  a) f` work as a proof?
Even nicer, changed!
Please add a comment saying that this lemma was generalized and the old version is now called `support_const_smul_subset`.
Like so? (If not, feel free to push a tweak to this comment yourself.)

AFAIK, we often leave `intro`s on the line with `:=`.
```suggestion
    support (f  g)  support f := fun x hfg hf 
  hfg <| by rw [Pi.smul_apply', hf, zero_smul]
```

```suggestion
theorem tsupport_smul_subset_right {M } [TopologicalSpace X] [Zero ] [SMulZeroClass M ]
```

```suggestion
    (f : X  M) (g : X  ) : (tsupport fun x => f x  g x)  tsupport g := 
  closure_mono <| support_smul_subset_right f g
```
`by apply` is useless most of the time. And the braces are not needed, that's the point of `<| `.
